35	standing here and there upon the slopes; for above them there was
35	often just such a flicker in the air as one sees on a hot day above
35	a sun-scorched beach. Putting things together, I reached a strong
35	suggestion of an extensive system of subterranean ventilation, whose
35	true import it was difficult to imagine. I was at first inclined to
35	associate it with the sanitary apparatus of these people. It was an
35	obvious conclusion, but it was absolutely wrong.
35	
35	'And here I must admit that I learned very little of drains and
35	bells and modes of conveyance, and the like conveniences, during my
35	time in this real future. In some of these visions of Utopias and
35	coming times which I have read, there is a vast amount of detail
35	about building, and social arrangements, and so forth. But while
35	such details are easy enough to obtain when the whole world is
35	contained in one's imagination, they are altogether inaccessible to
35	a real traveller amid such realities as I found here. Conceive the
35	tale of London which a negro, fresh from Central Africa, would take
35	back to his tribe! What would he know of railway companies, of
35	social movements, of telephone and telegraph wires, of the Parcels
35	Delivery Company, and postal orders and the like? Yet we, at least,
35	should be willing enough to explain these things to him! And even of
35	what he knew, how much could he make his untravelled friend either
35	apprehend or believe? Then, think how narrow the gap between a negro
35	and a white man of our own times, and how wide the interval between
35	myself and these of the Golden Age! I was sensible of much which was
35	unseen, and which contributed to my comfort; but save for a general
35	impression of automatic organization, I fear I can convey very
35	little of the difference to your mind.
35	
35	'In the matter of sepulture, for instance, I could see no signs of
35	crematoria nor anything suggestive of tombs. But it occurred to me
35	that, possibly, there might be cemeteries (or crematoria) somewhere
35	beyond the range of my explorings. This, again, was a question I
35	deliberately put to myself, and my curiosity was at first entirely
35	defeated upon the point. The thing puzzled me, and I was led to make
35	a further remark, which puzzled me still more: that aged and infirm
35	among this people there were none.
35	
35	'I must confess that my satisfaction with my first theories of an
35	automatic civilization and a decadent humanity did not long endure.
35	Yet I could think of no other. Let me put my difficulties. The
35	several big palaces I had explored were mere living places, great
35	dining-halls and sleeping apartments. I could find no machinery, no
35	appliances of any kind. Yet these people were clothed in pleasant
35	fabrics that must at times need renewal, and their sandals, though
35	undecorated, were fairly complex specimens of metalwork. Somehow
35	such things must be made. And the little people displayed no vestige
35	of a creative tendency. There were no shops, no workshops, no sign
35	of importations among them. They spent all their time in playing
35	gently, in bathing in the river, in making love in a half-playful
35	fashion, in eating fruit and sleeping. I could not see how things
35	were kept going.
35	
35	'Then, again, about the Time Machine: something, I knew not what,
35	had taken it into the hollow pedestal of the White Sphinx. Why? For
35	the life of me I could not imagine. Those waterless wells, too,
35	those flickering pillars. I felt I lacked a clue. I felt--how shall
35	I put it? Suppose you found an inscription, with sentences here and
35	there in excellent plain English, and interpolated therewith, others
35	made up of words, of letters even, absolutely unknown to you? Well,
35	on the third day of my visit, that was how the world of Eight
35	Hundred and Two Thousand Seven Hundred and One presented itself to
35	me!
35	
35	'That day, too, I made a friend--of a sort. It happened that, as I
35	was watching some of the little people bathing in a shallow, one of
35	them was seized with cramp and began drifting downstream. The main
35	current ran rather swiftly, but not too strongly for even a moderate
35	swimmer. It will give you an idea, therefore, of the strange
35	deficiency in these creatures, when I tell you that none made the
35	slightest attempt to rescue the weakly crying little thing which
35	was drowning before their eyes. When I realized this, I hurriedly
35	slipped off my clothes, and, wading in at a point lower down, I
35	caught the poor mite and drew her safe to land. A little rubbing of
35	the limbs soon brought her round, and I had the satisfaction of
35	seeing she was all right before I left her. I had got to such a low
35	estimate of her kind that I did not expect any gratitude from her.
35	In that, however, I was wrong.
35	
35	'This happened in the morning. In the afternoon I met my little
35	woman, as I believe it was, as I was returning towards my centre
35	from an exploration, and she received me with cries of delight and
35	presented me with a big garland of flowers--evidently made for me
35	and me alone. The thing took my imagination. Very possibly I had
35	been feeling desolate. At any rate I did my best to display my
35	appreciation of the gift. We were soon seated together in a little
35	stone arbour, engaged in conversation, chiefly of smiles. The
35	creature's friendliness affected me exactly as a child's might have
35	done. We passed each other flowers, and she kissed my hands. I did
35	the same to hers. Then I tried talk, and found that her name was
35	Weena, which, though I don't know what it meant, somehow seemed
35	appropriate enough. That was the beginning of a queer friendship
35	which lasted a week, and ended--as I will tell you!
35	
35	'She was exactly like a child. She wanted to be with me always. She
35	tried to follow me everywhere, and on my next journey out and about
35	it went to my heart to tire her down, and leave her at last,
35	exhausted and calling after me rather plaintively. But the problems
35	of the world had to be mastered. I had not, I said to myself, come
35	into the future to carry on a miniature flirtation. Yet her distress
35	when I left her was very great, her expostulations at the parting
35	were sometimes frantic, and I think, altogether, I had as much
35	trouble as comfort from her devotion. Nevertheless she was, somehow,
35	a very great comfort. I thought it was mere childish affection that
35	made her cling to me. Until it was too late, I did not clearly know
35	what I had inflicted upon her when I left her. Nor until it was too
35	late did I clearly understand what she was to me. For, by merely
35	seeming fond of me, and showing in her weak, futile way that she
35	cared for me, the little doll of a creature presently gave my return
35	to the neighbourhood of the White Sphinx almost the feeling of
35	coming home; and I would watch for her tiny figure of white and gold
35	so soon as I came over the hill.
35	
35	'It was from her, too, that I learned that fear had not yet left the
35	world. She was fearless enough in the daylight, and she had the
35	oddest confidence in me; for once, in a foolish moment, I made
35	threatening grimaces at her, and she simply laughed at them. But she
35	dreaded the dark, dreaded shadows, dreaded black things. Darkness
35	to her was the one thing dreadful. It was a singularly passionate
35	emotion, and it set me thinking and observing. I discovered then,
35	among other things, that these little people gathered into the great
35	houses after dark, and slept in droves. To enter upon them without a
35	light was to put them into a tumult of apprehension. I never found
35	one out of doors, or one sleeping alone within doors, after dark.
35	Yet I was still such a blockhead that I missed the lesson of that
35	fear, and in spite of Weena's distress I insisted upon sleeping away
35	from these slumbering multitudes.
35	
35	'It troubled her greatly, but in the end her odd affection for me
35	triumphed, and for five of the nights of our acquaintance, including
35	the last night of all, she slept with her head pillowed on my arm.
35	But my story slips away from me as I speak of her. It must have been
35	the night before her rescue that I was awakened about dawn. I had
35	been restless, dreaming most disagreeably that I was drowned, and
35	that sea anemones were feeling over my face with their soft palps.
35	I woke with a start, and with an odd fancy that some greyish animal
35	had just rushed out of the chamber. I tried to get to sleep again,
35	but I felt restless and uncomfortable. It was that dim grey hour
35	when things are just creeping out of darkness, when everything is
35	colourless and clear cut, and yet unreal. I got up, and went down
35	into the great hall, and so out upon the flagstones in front of the
35	palace. I thought I would make a virtue of necessity, and see the
35	sunrise.
35	
35	'The moon was setting, and the dying moonlight and the first pallor
35	of dawn were mingled in a ghastly half-light. The bushes were inky
35	black, the ground a sombre grey, the sky colourless and cheerless.
35	And up the hill I thought I could see ghosts. There several times,
35	as I scanned the slope, I saw white figures. Twice I fancied I saw
35	a solitary white, ape-like creature running rather quickly up the
35	hill, and once near the ruins I saw a leash of them carrying some
35	dark body. They moved hastily. I did not see what became of them.
35	It seemed that they vanished among the bushes. The dawn was still
35	indistinct, you must understand. I was feeling that chill,
35	uncertain, early-morning feeling you may have known. I doubted
35	my eyes.
35	
35	'As the eastern sky grew brighter, and the light of the day came on
35	and its vivid colouring returned upon the world once more, I scanned
35	the view keenly. But I saw no vestige of my white figures. They were
35	mere creatures of the half light. ""They must have been ghosts,"" I
35	said; ""I wonder whence they dated."" For a queer notion of Grant
35	Allen's came into my head, and amused me. If each generation die and
35	leave ghosts, he argued, the world at last will get overcrowded with
35	them. On that theory they would have grown innumerable some Eight
35	Hundred Thousand Years hence, and it was no great wonder to see four
35	at once. But the jest was unsatisfying, and I was thinking of these
35	figures all the morning, until Weena's rescue drove them out of my
35	head. I associated them in some indefinite way with the white animal
35	I had startled in my first passionate search for the Time Machine.
35	But Weena was a pleasant substitute. Yet all the same, they were
35	soon destined to take far deadlier possession of my mind.
35	
35	'I think I have said how much hotter than our own was the weather
35	of this Golden Age. I cannot account for it. It may be that the sun
35	was hotter, or the earth nearer the sun. It is usual to assume that
35	the sun will go on cooling steadily in the future. But people,
35	unfamiliar with such speculations as those of the younger Darwin,
35	forget that the planets must ultimately fall back one by one into
35	the parent body. As these catastrophes occur, the sun will blaze
35	with renewed energy; and it may be that some inner planet had
35	suffered this fate. Whatever the reason, the fact remains that the
35	sun was very much hotter than we know it.
35	
35	'Well, one very hot morning--my fourth, I think--as I was seeking
35	shelter from the heat and glare in a colossal ruin near the great
35	house where I slept and fed, there happened this strange thing:
35	Clambering among these heaps of masonry, I found a narrow gallery,
35	whose end and side windows were blocked by fallen masses of stone.
35	By contrast with the brilliancy outside, it seemed at first
35	impenetrably dark to me. I entered it groping, for the change from
35	light to blackness made spots of colour swim before me. Suddenly I
35	halted spellbound. A pair of eyes, luminous by reflection against
35	the daylight without, was watching me out of the darkness.
35	
35	'The old instinctive dread of wild beasts came upon me. I clenched
35	my hands and steadfastly looked into the glaring eyeballs. I was
35	afraid to turn. Then the thought of the absolute security in which
35	humanity appeared to be living came to my mind. And then I
35	remembered that strange terror of the dark. Overcoming my fear to
35	some extent, I advanced a step and spoke. I will admit that my
35	voice was harsh and ill-controlled. I put out my hand and touched
35	something soft. At once the eyes darted sideways, and something
35	white ran past me. I turned with my heart in my mouth, and saw a
35	queer little ape-like figure, its head held down in a peculiar
35	manner, running across the sunlit space behind me. It blundered
35	against a block of granite, staggered aside, and in a moment was
35	hidden in a black shadow beneath another pile of ruined masonry.
35	
35	'My impression of it is, of course, imperfect; but I know it was a
35	dull white, and had strange large greyish-red eyes; also that there
35	was flaxen hair on its head and down its back. But, as I say, it
35	went too fast for me to see distinctly. I cannot even say whether it
35	ran on all-fours, or only with its forearms held very low. After an
35	instant's pause I followed it into the second heap of ruins. I could
35	not find it at first; but, after a time in the profound obscurity, I
35	came upon one of those round well-like openings of which I have told
35	you, half closed by a fallen pillar. A sudden thought came to me.
35	Could this Thing have vanished down the shaft? I lit a match, and,
35	looking down, I saw a small, white, moving creature, with large
35	bright eyes which regarded me steadfastly as it retreated. It made
35	me shudder. It was so like a human spider! It was clambering down
35	the wall, and now I saw for the first time a number of metal foot
35	and hand rests forming a kind of ladder down the shaft. Then the
35	light burned my fingers and fell out of my hand, going out as it
35	dropped, and when I had lit another the little monster had
35	disappeared.
35	
35	'I do not know how long I sat peering down that well. It was not for
35	some time that I could succeed in persuading myself that the thing I
35	had seen was human. But, gradually, the truth dawned on me: that
35	Man had not remained one species, but had differentiated into two
35	distinct animals: that my graceful children of the Upper-world were
35	not the sole descendants of our generation, but that this bleached,
35	obscene, nocturnal Thing, which had flashed before me, was also heir
35	to all the ages.
35	
35	'I thought of the flickering pillars and of my theory of an
35	underground ventilation. I began to suspect their true import. And
35	what, I wondered, was this Lemur doing in my scheme of a perfectly
35	balanced organization? How was it related to the indolent serenity
35	of the beautiful Upper-worlders? And what was hidden down there,
35	at the foot of that shaft? I sat upon the edge of the well telling
35	myself that, at any rate, there was nothing to fear, and that there
35	I must descend for the solution of my difficulties. And withal I
35	was absolutely afraid to go! As I hesitated, two of the beautiful
35	Upper-world people came running in their amorous sport across the
35	daylight in the shadow. The male pursued the female, flinging
35	flowers at her as he ran.
35	
35	'They seemed distressed to find me, my arm against the overturned
35	pillar, peering down the well. Apparently it was considered bad form
35	to remark these apertures; for when I pointed to this one, and tried
35	to frame a question about it in their tongue, they were still more
35	visibly distressed and turned away. But they were interested by my
35	matches, and I struck some to amuse them. I tried them again about
35	the well, and again I failed. So presently I left them, meaning to
35	go back to Weena, and see what I could get from her. But my mind was
35	already in revolution; my guesses and impressions were slipping and
35	sliding to a new adjustment. I had now a clue to the import of these
35	wells, to the ventilating towers, to the mystery of the ghosts; to
35	say nothing of a hint at the meaning of the bronze gates and the
35	fate of the Time Machine! And very vaguely there came a suggestion
35	towards the solution of the economic problem that had puzzled me.
35	
35	'Here was the new view. Plainly, this second species of Man was
35	subterranean. There were three circumstances in particular which
35	made me think that its rare emergence above ground was the outcome
35	of a long-continued underground habit. In the first place, there was
35	the bleached look common in most animals that live largely in the
35	dark--the white fish of the Kentucky caves, for instance. Then,
35	those large eyes, with that capacity for reflecting light, are
35	common features of nocturnal things--witness the owl and the cat.
35	And last of all, that evident confusion in the sunshine, that hasty
35	yet fumbling awkward flight towards dark shadow, and that peculiar
35	carriage of the head while in the light--all reinforced the theory
35	of an extreme sensitiveness of the retina.
35	
35	'Beneath my feet, then, the earth must be tunnelled enormously, and
35	these tunnellings were the habitat of the new race. The presence of
35	ventilating shafts and wells along the hill slopes--everywhere, in
35	fact, except along the river valley--showed how universal were its
35	ramifications. What so natural, then, as to assume that it was in
35	this artificial Underworld that such work as was necessary to the
35	comfort of the daylight race was done? The notion was so plausible
35	that I at once accepted it, and went on to assume the _how_ of this
35	splitting of the human species. I dare say you will anticipate the
35	shape of my theory; though, for myself, I very soon felt that it
35	fell far short of the truth.
35	
35	'At first, proceeding from the problems of our own age, it seemed
35	clear as daylight to me that the gradual widening of the present
35	merely temporary and social difference between the Capitalist and
35	the Labourer, was the key to the whole position. No doubt it will
35	seem grotesque enough to you--and wildly incredible!--and yet even
35	now there are existing circumstances to point that way. There is
35	a tendency to utilize underground space for the less ornamental
35	purposes of civilization; there is the Metropolitan Railway in
35	London, for instance, there are new electric railways, there are
35	subways, there are underground workrooms and restaurants, and they
35	increase and multiply. Evidently, I thought, this tendency had
35	increased till Industry had gradually lost its birthright in the
35	sky. I mean that it had gone deeper and deeper into larger and ever
35	larger underground factories, spending a still-increasing amount of
35	its time therein, till, in the end--! Even now, does not an East-end
35	worker live in such artificial conditions as practically to be cut
35	off from the natural surface of the earth?
35	
35	'Again, the exclusive tendency of richer people--due, no doubt, to
35	the increasing refinement of their education, and the widening gulf
35	between them and the rude violence of the poor--is already leading
35	to the closing, in their interest, of considerable portions of the
35	surface of the land. About London, for instance, perhaps half the
35	prettier country is shut in against intrusion. And this same
35	widening gulf--which is due to the length and expense of the higher
35	educational process and the increased facilities for and temptations
35	towards refined habits on the part of the rich--will make that
35	exchange between class and class, that promotion by intermarriage
35	which at present retards the splitting of our species along lines
35	of social stratification, less and less frequent. So, in the end,
35	above ground you must have the Haves, pursuing pleasure and comfort
35	and beauty, and below ground the Have-nots, the Workers getting
35	continually adapted to the conditions of their labour. Once they
35	were there, they would no doubt have to pay rent, and not a little
35	of it, for the ventilation of their caverns; and if they refused,
35	they would starve or be suffocated for arrears. Such of them as were
35	so constituted as to be miserable and rebellious would die; and, in
35	the end, the balance being permanent, the survivors would become as
35	well adapted to the conditions of underground life, and as happy in
35	their way, as the Upper-world people were to theirs. As it seemed to
35	me, the refined beauty and the etiolated pallor followed naturally
35	enough.
35	
35	'The great triumph of Humanity I had dreamed of took a different
35	shape in my mind. It had been no such triumph of moral education and
35	general co-operation as I had imagined. Instead, I saw a real
35	aristocracy, armed with a perfected science and working to a logical
35	conclusion the industrial system of to-day. Its triumph had not been
35	simply a triumph over Nature, but a triumph over Nature and the
35	fellow-man. This, I must warn you, was my theory at the time. I had
35	no convenient cicerone in the pattern of the Utopian books. My
35	explanation may be absolutely wrong. I still think it is the
35	most plausible one. But even on this supposition the balanced
35	civilization that was at last attained must have long since passed
35	its zenith, and was now far fallen into decay. The too-perfect
35	security of the Upper-worlders had led them to a slow movement of
35	degeneration, to a general dwindling in size, strength, and
35	intelligence. That I could see clearly enough already. What had
35	happened to the Under-grounders I did not yet suspect; but from what
35	I had seen of the Morlocks--that, by the by, was the name by which
35	these creatures were called--I could imagine that the modification
35	of the human type was even far more profound than among the ""Eloi,""
35	the beautiful race that I already knew.
35	
35	'Then came troublesome doubts. Why had the Morlocks taken my Time
35	Machine? For I felt sure it was they who had taken it. Why, too, if
35	the Eloi were masters, could they not restore the machine to me? And
35	why were they so terribly afraid of the dark? I proceeded, as I have
35	said, to question Weena about this Under-world, but here again I was
35	disappointed. At first she would not understand my questions, and
35	presently she refused to answer them. She shivered as though the
35	topic was unendurable. And when I pressed her, perhaps a little
35	harshly, she burst into tears. They were the only tears, except my
35	own, I ever saw in that Golden Age. When I saw them I ceased
35	abruptly to trouble about the Morlocks, and was only concerned in
35	banishing these signs of the human inheritance from Weena's eyes.
35	And very soon she was smiling and clapping her hands, while I
35	solemnly burned a match.
35	
35	
35	
35	
35	VI
35	
35	
35	'It may seem odd to you, but it was two days before I could follow
35	up the new-found clue in what was manifestly the proper way. I felt
35	a peculiar shrinking from those pallid bodies. They were just the
35	half-bleached colour of the worms and things one sees preserved in
35	spirit in a zoological museum. And they were filthily cold to the
35	touch. Probably my shrinking was largely due to the sympathetic
35	influence of the Eloi, whose disgust of the Morlocks I now began
35	to appreciate.
35	
35	'The next night I did not sleep well. Probably my health was a
35	little disordered. I was oppressed with perplexity and doubt. Once
35	or twice I had a feeling of intense fear for which I could perceive
35	no definite reason. I remember creeping noiselessly into the great
35	hall where the little people were sleeping in the moonlight--that
35	night Weena was among them--and feeling reassured by their presence.
35	It occurred to me even then, that in the course of a few days the
35	moon must pass through its last quarter, and the nights grow dark,
35	when the appearances of these unpleasant creatures from below, these
35	whitened Lemurs, this new vermin that had replaced the old, might be
35	more abundant. And on both these days I had the restless feeling of
35	one who shirks an inevitable duty. I felt assured that the Time
35	Machine was only to be recovered by boldly penetrating these
35	underground mysteries. Yet I could not face the mystery. If only I
35	had had a companion it would have been different. But I was so
35	horribly alone, and even to clamber down into the darkness of the
35	well appalled me. I don't know if you will understand my feeling,
35	but I never felt quite safe at my back.
35	
35	'It was this restlessness, this insecurity, perhaps, that drove me
35	further and further afield in my exploring expeditions. Going to the
35	south-westward towards the rising country that is now called Combe
35	Wood, I observed far off, in the direction of nineteenth-century
35	Banstead, a vast green structure, different in character from any
35	I had hitherto seen. It was larger than the largest of the palaces
35	or ruins I knew, and the facade had an Oriental look: the face
35	of it having the lustre, as well as the pale-green tint, a kind
35	of bluish-green, of a certain type of Chinese porcelain. This
35	difference in aspect suggested a difference in use, and I was minded
35	to push on and explore. But the day was growing late, and I had come
35	upon the sight of the place after a long and tiring circuit; so I
35	resolved to hold over the adventure for the following day, and I
35	returned to the welcome and the caresses of little Weena. But next
35	morning I perceived clearly enough that my curiosity regarding the
35	Palace of Green Porcelain was a piece of self-deception, to enable
35	me to shirk, by another day, an experience I dreaded. I resolved I
35	would make the descent without further waste of time, and started
35	out in the early morning towards a well near the ruins of granite
35	and aluminium.
35	
35	'Little Weena ran with me. She danced beside me to the well, but
35	when she saw me lean over the mouth and look downward, she seemed
35	strangely disconcerted. ""Good-bye, little Weena,"" I said, kissing
35	her; and then putting her down, I began to feel over the parapet
35	for the climbing hooks. Rather hastily, I may as well confess, for
35	I feared my courage might leak away! At first she watched me in
35	amazement. Then she gave a most piteous cry, and running to me, she
35	began to pull at me with her little hands. I think her opposition
35	nerved me rather to proceed. I shook her off, perhaps a little
35	roughly, and in another moment I was in the throat of the well. I
35	saw her agonized face over the parapet, and smiled to reassure her.
35	Then I had to look down at the unstable hooks to which I clung.
35	
35	'I had to clamber down a shaft of perhaps two hundred yards. The
35	descent was effected by means of metallic bars projecting from
35	the sides of the well, and these being adapted to the needs of
35	a creature much smaller and lighter than myself, I was speedily
35	cramped and fatigued by the descent. And not simply fatigued! One of
35	the bars bent suddenly under my weight, and almost swung me off into
35	the blackness beneath. For a moment I hung by one hand, and after
35	that experience I did not dare to rest again. Though my arms and
35	back were presently acutely painful, I went on clambering down the
35	sheer descent with as quick a motion as possible. Glancing upward,
35	I saw the aperture, a small blue disk, in which a star was visible,
35	while little Weena's head showed as a round black projection. The
35	thudding sound of a machine below grew louder and more oppressive.
35	Everything save that little disk above was profoundly dark, and when
35	I looked up again Weena had disappeared.
35	
35	'I was in an agony of discomfort. I had some thought of trying to go
35	up the shaft again, and leave the Under-world alone. But even while
35	I turned this over in my mind I continued to descend. At last, with
35	intense relief, I saw dimly coming up, a foot to the right of me, a
35	slender loophole in the wall. Swinging myself in, I found it was the
35	aperture of a narrow horizontal tunnel in which I could lie down and
35	rest. It was not too soon. My arms ached, my back was cramped, and I
35	was trembling with the prolonged terror of a fall. Besides this, the
35	unbroken darkness had had a distressing effect upon my eyes. The air
35	was full of the throb and hum of machinery pumping air down the
35	shaft.
35	
35	'I do not know how long I lay. I was roused by a soft hand touching
35	my face. Starting up in the darkness I snatched at my matches and,
35	hastily striking one, I saw three stooping white creatures similar
35	to the one I had seen above ground in the ruin, hastily retreating
35	before the light. Living, as they did, in what appeared to me
35	impenetrable darkness, their eyes were abnormally large and
35	sensitive, just as are the pupils of the abysmal fishes, and they
35	reflected the light in the same way. I have no doubt they could see
35	me in that rayless obscurity, and they did not seem to have any fear
35	of me apart from the light. But, so soon as I struck a match in
35	order to see them, they fled incontinently, vanishing into dark
35	gutters and tunnels, from which their eyes glared at me in the
35	strangest fashion.
35	
35	'I tried to call to them, but the language they had was apparently
35	different from that of the Over-world people; so that I was needs
35	left to my own unaided efforts, and the thought of flight before
35	exploration was even then in my mind. But I said to myself, ""You are
35	in for it now,"" and, feeling my way along the tunnel, I found the
35	noise of machinery grow louder. Presently the walls fell away from
35	me, and I came to a large open space, and striking another match,
35	saw that I had entered a vast arched cavern, which stretched into
35	utter darkness beyond the range of my light. The view I had of it
35	was as much as one could see in the burning of a match.
35	
35	'Necessarily my memory is vague. Great shapes like big machines rose
35	out of the dimness, and cast grotesque black shadows, in which dim
35	spectral Morlocks sheltered from the glare. The place, by the by,
35	was very stuffy and oppressive, and the faint halitus of freshly
35	shed blood was in the air. Some way down the central vista was a
35	little table of white metal, laid with what seemed a meal. The
35	Morlocks at any rate were carnivorous! Even at the time, I remember
35	wondering what large animal could have survived to furnish the red
35	joint I saw. It was all very indistinct: the heavy smell, the big
35	unmeaning shapes, the obscene figures lurking in the shadows, and
35	only waiting for the darkness to come at me again! Then the match
35	burned down, and stung my fingers, and fell, a wriggling red spot
35	in the blackness.
35	
35	'I have thought since how particularly ill-equipped I was for such
35	an experience. When I had started with the Time Machine, I had
35	started with the absurd assumption that the men of the Future would
35	certainly be infinitely ahead of ourselves in all their appliances.
35	I had come without arms, without medicine, without anything to
35	smoke--at times I missed tobacco frightfully--even without enough
35	matches. If only I had thought of a Kodak! I could have flashed that
35	glimpse of the Underworld in a second, and examined it at leisure.
35	But, as it was, I stood there with only the weapons and the powers
35	that Nature had endowed me with--hands, feet, and teeth; these, and
35	four safety-matches that still remained to me.
35	
35	'I was afraid to push my way in among all this machinery in the
35	dark, and it was only with my last glimpse of light I discovered
35	that my store of matches had run low. It had never occurred to me
35	until that moment that there was any need to economize them, and I
35	had wasted almost half the box in astonishing the Upper-worlders, to
35	whom fire was a novelty. Now, as I say, I had four left, and while I
35	stood in the dark, a hand touched mine, lank fingers came feeling
35	over my face, and I was sensible of a peculiar unpleasant odour. I
35	fancied I heard the breathing of a crowd of those dreadful little
35	beings about me. I felt the box of matches in my hand being gently
35	disengaged, and other hands behind me plucking at my clothing. The
35	sense of these unseen creatures examining me was indescribably
35	unpleasant. The sudden realization of my ignorance of their ways of
35	thinking and doing came home to me very vividly in the darkness. I
35	shouted at them as loudly as I could. They started away, and then
35	I could feel them approaching me again. They clutched at me more
35	boldly, whispering odd sounds to each other. I shivered violently,
35	and shouted again--rather discordantly. This time they were not so
35	seriously alarmed, and they made a queer laughing noise as they came
35	back at me. I will confess I was horribly frightened. I determined
35	to strike another match and escape under the protection of its
35	glare. I did so, and eking out the flicker with a scrap of paper
35	from my pocket, I made good my retreat to the narrow tunnel. But I
35	had scarce entered this when my light was blown out and in the
35	blackness I could hear the Morlocks rustling like wind among leaves,
35	and pattering like the rain, as they hurried after me.
35	
35	'In a moment I was clutched by several hands, and there was no
35	mistaking that they were trying to haul me back. I struck another
35	light, and waved it in their dazzled faces. You can scarce imagine
35	how nauseatingly inhuman they looked--those pale, chinless faces
35	and great, lidless, pinkish-grey eyes!--as they stared in their
35	blindness and bewilderment. But I did not stay to look, I promise
35	you: I retreated again, and when my second match had ended, I struck
35	my third. It had almost burned through when I reached the opening
35	into the shaft. I lay down on the edge, for the throb of the great
35	pump below made me giddy. Then I felt sideways for the projecting
35	hooks, and, as I did so, my feet were grasped from behind, and I
35	was violently tugged backward. I lit my last match ... and it
35	incontinently went out. But I had my hand on the climbing bars now,
35	and, kicking violently, I disengaged myself from the clutches of the
35	Morlocks and was speedily clambering up the shaft, while they stayed
35	peering and blinking up at me: all but one little wretch who
35	followed me for some way, and well-nigh secured my boot as a trophy.
35	
35	'That climb seemed interminable to me. With the last twenty or
35	thirty feet of it a deadly nausea came upon me. I had the greatest
35	difficulty in keeping my hold. The last few yards was a frightful
35	struggle against this faintness. Several times my head swam, and I
35	felt all the sensations of falling. At last, however, I got over the
35	well-mouth somehow, and staggered out of the ruin into the blinding
35	sunlight. I fell upon my face. Even the soil smelt sweet and clean.
35	Then I remember Weena kissing my hands and ears, and the voices of
35	others among the Eloi. Then, for a time, I was insensible.
35	
35	
35	
35	
35	VII
35	
35	
35	'Now, indeed, I seemed in a worse case than before. Hitherto,
35	except during my night's anguish at the loss of the Time Machine,
35	I had felt a sustaining hope of ultimate escape, but that hope was
35	staggered by these new discoveries. Hitherto I had merely thought
35	myself impeded by the childish simplicity of the little people, and
35	by some unknown forces which I had only to understand to overcome;
35	but there was an altogether new element in the sickening quality of
35	the Morlocks--a something inhuman and malign. Instinctively I
35	loathed them. Before, I had felt as a man might feel who had fallen
35	into a pit: my concern was with the pit and how to get out of it.
35	Now I felt like a beast in a trap, whose enemy would come upon him
35	soon.
35	
35	'The enemy I dreaded may surprise you. It was the darkness of the
35	new moon. Weena had put this into my head by some at first
35	incomprehensible remarks about the Dark Nights. It was not now
35	such a very difficult problem to guess what the coming Dark Nights
35	might mean. The moon was on the wane: each night there was a longer
35	interval of darkness. And I now understood to some slight degree at
35	least the reason of the fear of the little Upper-world people for
35	the dark. I wondered vaguely what foul villainy it might be that
35	the Morlocks did under the new moon. I felt pretty sure now that
35	my second hypothesis was all wrong. The Upper-world people might
35	once have been the favoured aristocracy, and the Morlocks their
35	mechanical servants: but that had long since passed away. The two
35	species that had resulted from the evolution of man were sliding
35	down towards, or had already arrived at, an altogether new
35	relationship. The Eloi, like the Carolingian kings, had decayed
35	to a mere beautiful futility. They still possessed the earth on
35	sufferance: since the Morlocks, subterranean for innumerable
35	generations, had come at last to find the daylit surface
35	intolerable. And the Morlocks made their garments, I inferred, and
35	maintained them in their habitual needs, perhaps through the
35	survival of an old habit of service. They did it as a standing horse
35	paws with his foot, or as a man enjoys killing animals in sport:
35	because ancient and departed necessities had impressed it on the
35	organism. But, clearly, the old order was already in part reversed.
35	The Nemesis of the delicate ones was creeping on apace. Ages ago,
35	thousands of generations ago, man had thrust his brother man out of
35	the ease and the sunshine. And now that brother was coming back
35	changed! Already the Eloi had begun to learn one old lesson anew.
35	They were becoming reacquainted with Fear. And suddenly there came
35	into my head the memory of the meat I had seen in the Under-world.
35	It seemed odd how it floated into my mind: not stirred up as it
35	were by the current of my meditations, but coming in almost like a
35	question from outside. I tried to recall the form of it. I had a
35	vague sense of something familiar, but I could not tell what it was
35	at the time.
35	
35	'Still, however helpless the little people in the presence of their
35	mysterious Fear, I was differently constituted. I came out of this
35	age of ours, this ripe prime of the human race, when Fear does not
35	paralyse and mystery has lost its terrors. I at least would defend
35	myself. Without further delay I determined to make myself arms and a
35	fastness where I might sleep. With that refuge as a base, I could
35	face this strange world with some of that confidence I had lost in
35	realizing to what creatures night by night I lay exposed. I felt
35	I could never sleep again until my bed was secure from them. I
35	shuddered with horror to think how they must already have examined
35	me.
35	
35	'I wandered during the afternoon along the valley of the Thames, but
35	found nothing that commended itself to my mind as inaccessible. All
35	the buildings and trees seemed easily practicable to such dexterous
35	climbers as the Morlocks, to judge by their wells, must be. Then the
35	tall pinnacles of the Palace of Green Porcelain and the polished
35	gleam of its walls came back to my memory; and in the evening,
35	taking Weena like a child upon my shoulder, I went up the hills
35	towards the south-west. The distance, I had reckoned, was seven or
35	eight miles, but it must have been nearer eighteen. I had first seen
35	the place on a moist afternoon when distances are deceptively
35	diminished. In addition, the heel of one of my shoes was loose, and
35	a nail was working through the sole--they were comfortable old shoes
35	I wore about indoors--so that I was lame. And it was already long
35	past sunset when I came in sight of the palace, silhouetted black
35	against the pale yellow of the sky.
35	
35	'Weena had been hugely delighted when I began to carry her, but
35	after a while she desired me to let her down, and ran along by the
35	side of me, occasionally darting off on either hand to pick flowers
35	to stick in my pockets. My pockets had always puzzled Weena, but at
35	the last she had concluded that they were an eccentric kind of vase
35	for floral decoration. At least she utilized them for that purpose.
35	And that reminds me! In changing my jacket I found...'
35	
35	The Time Traveller paused, put his hand into his pocket, and
35	silently placed two withered flowers, not unlike very large white
35	mallows, upon the little table. Then he resumed his narrative.
35	
35	'As the hush of evening crept over the world and we proceeded over
35	the hill crest towards Wimbledon, Weena grew tired and wanted to
35	return to the house of grey stone. But I pointed out the distant
35	pinnacles of the Palace of Green Porcelain to her, and contrived to
35	make her understand that we were seeking a refuge there from her
35	Fear. You know that great pause that comes upon things before the
35	dusk? Even the breeze stops in the trees. To me there is always an
35	air of expectation about that evening stillness. The sky was clear,
35	remote, and empty save for a few horizontal bars far down in the
35	sunset. Well, that night the expectation took the colour of my
35	fears. In that darkling calm my senses seemed preternaturally
35	sharpened. I fancied I could even feel the hollowness of the ground
35	beneath my feet: could, indeed, almost see through it the Morlocks
35	on their ant-hill going hither and thither and waiting for the dark.
35	In my excitement I fancied that they would receive my invasion of
35	their burrows as a declaration of war. And why had they taken my
35	Time Machine?
35	
35	'So we went on in the quiet, and the twilight deepened into night.
35	The clear blue of the distance faded, and one star after another
35	came out. The ground grew dim and the trees black. Weena's fears and
35	her fatigue grew upon her. I took her in my arms and talked to her
35	and caressed her. Then, as the darkness grew deeper, she put her
35	arms round my neck, and, closing her eyes, tightly pressed her face
35	against my shoulder. So we went down a long slope into a valley, and
35	there in the dimness I almost walked into a little river. This I
35	waded, and went up the opposite side of the valley, past a number
35	of sleeping houses, and by a statue--a Faun, or some such figure,
35	_minus_ the head. Here too were acacias. So far I had seen nothing of
35	the Morlocks, but it was yet early in the night, and the darker hours
35	before the old moon rose were still to come.
35	
35	'From the brow of the next hill I saw a thick wood spreading wide
35	and black before me. I hesitated at this. I could see no end to
35	it, either to the right or the left. Feeling tired--my feet, in
35	particular, were very sore--I carefully lowered Weena from my
35	shoulder as I halted, and sat down upon the turf. I could no
35	longer see the Palace of Green Porcelain, and I was in doubt of my
35	direction. I looked into the thickness of the wood and thought of
35	what it might hide. Under that dense tangle of branches one would
35	be out of sight of the stars. Even were there no other lurking
35	danger--a danger I did not care to let my imagination loose
35	upon--there would still be all the roots to stumble over and the
35	tree-boles to strike against.
35	
35	'I was very tired, too, after the excitements of the day; so I
35	decided that I would not face it, but would pass the night upon the
35	open hill.
35	
35	'Weena, I was glad to find, was fast asleep. I carefully wrapped her
35	in my jacket, and sat down beside her to wait for the moonrise. The
35	hill-side was quiet and deserted, but from the black of the wood
35	there came now and then a stir of living things. Above me shone the
35	stars, for the night was very clear. I felt a certain sense of
35	friendly comfort in their twinkling. All the old constellations
35	had gone from the sky, however: that slow movement which is
35	imperceptible in a hundred human lifetimes, had long since
35	rearranged them in unfamiliar groupings. But the Milky Way, it
35	seemed to me, was still the same tattered streamer of star-dust as
35	of yore. Southward (as I judged it) was a very bright red star that
35	was new to me; it was even more splendid than our own green Sirius.
35	And amid all these scintillating points of light one bright planet
35	shone kindly and steadily like the face of an old friend.
35	
35	'Looking at these stars suddenly dwarfed my own troubles and all
35	the gravities of terrestrial life. I thought of their unfathomable
35	distance, and the slow inevitable drift of their movements out of
35	the unknown past into the unknown future. I thought of the great
35	precessional cycle that the pole of the earth describes. Only forty
35	times had that silent revolution occurred during all the years that
35	I had traversed. And during these few revolutions all the activity,
35	all the traditions, the complex organizations, the nations,
35	languages, literatures, aspirations, even the mere memory of Man as
35	I knew him, had been swept out of existence. Instead were these
35	frail creatures who had forgotten their high ancestry, and the white
35	Things of which I went in terror. Then I thought of the Great Fear
35	that was between the two species, and for the first time, with a
35	sudden shiver, came the clear knowledge of what the meat I had seen
35	might be. Yet it was too horrible! I looked at little Weena sleeping
35	beside me, her face white and starlike under the stars, and
35	forthwith dismissed the thought.
35	
35	'Through that long night I held my mind off the Morlocks as well as
35	I could, and whiled away the time by trying to fancy I could find
35	signs of the old constellations in the new confusion. The sky kept
35	very clear, except for a hazy cloud or so. No doubt I dozed at
35	times. Then, as my vigil wore on, came a faintness in the eastward
35	sky, like the reflection of some colourless fire, and the old moon
35	rose, thin and peaked and white. And close behind, and overtaking
35	it, and overflowing it, the dawn came, pale at first, and then
35	growing pink and warm. No Morlocks had approached us. Indeed, I had
35	seen none upon the hill that night. And in the confidence of renewed
35	day it almost seemed to me that my fear had been unreasonable. I
35	stood up and found my foot with the loose heel swollen at the ankle
35	and painful under the heel; so I sat down again, took off my shoes,
35	and flung them away.
35	
35	'I awakened Weena, and we went down into the wood, now green and
35	pleasant instead of black and forbidding. We found some fruit
35	wherewith to break our fast. We soon met others of the dainty ones,
35	laughing and dancing in the sunlight as though there was no such
35	thing in nature as the night. And then I thought once more of the
35	meat that I had seen. I felt assured now of what it was, and from
35	the bottom of my heart I pitied this last feeble rill from the great
35	flood of humanity. Clearly, at some time in the Long-Ago of human
35	decay the Morlocks' food had run short. Possibly they had lived on
35	rats and such-like vermin. Even now man is far less discriminating
35	and exclusive in his food than he was--far less than any monkey. His
35	prejudice against human flesh is no deep-seated instinct. And so
35	these inhuman sons of men----! I tried to look at the thing in a
35	scientific spirit. After all, they were less human and more remote
35	than our cannibal ancestors of three or four thousand years ago.
35	And the intelligence that would have made this state of things a
35	torment had gone. Why should I trouble myself? These Eloi were mere
35	fatted cattle, which the ant-like Morlocks preserved and preyed
35	upon--probably saw to the breeding of. And there was Weena dancing
35	at my side!
35	
35	'Then I tried to preserve myself from the horror that was coming
35	upon me, by regarding it as a rigorous punishment of human
35	selfishness. Man had been content to live in ease and delight upon
35	the labours of his fellow-man, had taken Necessity as his watchword
35	and excuse, and in the fullness of time Necessity had come home to
35	him. I even tried a Carlyle-like scorn of this wretched aristocracy
35	in decay. But this attitude of mind was impossible. However great
35	their intellectual degradation, the Eloi had kept too much of the
35	human form not to claim my sympathy, and to make me perforce a
35	sharer in their degradation and their Fear.
35	
35	'I had at that time very vague ideas as to the course I should
35	pursue. My first was to secure some safe place of refuge, and to
35	make myself such arms of metal or stone as I could contrive. That
35	necessity was immediate. In the next place, I hoped to procure some
35	means of fire, so that I should have the weapon of a torch at hand,
35	for nothing, I knew, would be more efficient against these Morlocks.
35	Then I wanted to arrange some contrivance to break open the doors of
35	bronze under the White Sphinx. I had in mind a battering ram. I had
35	a persuasion that if I could enter those doors and carry a blaze of
35	light before me I should discover the Time Machine and escape. I
35	could not imagine the Morlocks were strong enough to move it far
35	away. Weena I had resolved to bring with me to our own time. And
35	turning such schemes over in my mind I pursued our way towards the
35	building which my fancy had chosen as our dwelling.
35	
35	
35	
35	
35	VIII
35	
35	
35	'I found the Palace of Green Porcelain, when we approached it about
35	noon, deserted and falling into ruin. Only ragged vestiges of glass
35	remained in its windows, and great sheets of the green facing had
35	fallen away from the corroded metallic framework. It lay very high
35	upon a turfy down, and looking north-eastward before I entered it, I
35	was surprised to see a large estuary, or even creek, where I judged
35	Wandsworth and Battersea must once have been. I thought then--though
35	I never followed up the thought--of what might have happened, or
35	might be happening, to the living things in the sea.
35	
35	'The material of the Palace proved on examination to be indeed
35	porcelain, and along the face of it I saw an inscription in some
35	unknown character. I thought, rather foolishly, that Weena might
35	help me to interpret this, but I only learned that the bare idea of
35	writing had never entered her head. She always seemed to me, I
35	fancy, more human than she was, perhaps because her affection was so
35	human.
35	
35	'Within the big valves of the door--which were open and broken--we
35	found, instead of the customary hall, a long gallery lit by many
35	side windows. At the first glance I was reminded of a museum.
35	The tiled floor was thick with dust, and a remarkable array of
35	miscellaneous objects was shrouded in the same grey covering. Then
35	I perceived, standing strange and gaunt in the centre of the hall,
35	what was clearly the lower part of a huge skeleton. I recognized
35	by the oblique feet that it was some extinct creature after the
35	fashion of the Megatherium. The skull and the upper bones lay
35	beside it in the thick dust, and in one place, where rain-water had
35	dropped through a leak in the roof, the thing itself had been worn
35	away. Further in the gallery was the huge skeleton barrel of a
35	Brontosaurus. My museum hypothesis was confirmed. Going towards the
35	side I found what appeared to be sloping shelves, and clearing away
35	the thick dust, I found the old familiar glass cases of our own
35	time. But they must have been air-tight to judge from the fair
35	preservation of some of their contents.
35	
35	'Clearly we stood among the ruins of some latter-day South
35	Kensington! Here, apparently, was the Palaeontological Section,
35	and a very splendid array of fossils it must have been, though the
35	inevitable process of decay that had been staved off for a time, and
35	had, through the extinction of bacteria and fungi, lost ninety-nine
35	hundredths of its force, was nevertheless, with extreme sureness if
35	with extreme slowness at work again upon all its treasures. Here and
35	there I found traces of the little people in the shape of rare
35	fossils broken to pieces or threaded in strings upon reeds. And the
35	cases had in some instances been bodily removed--by the Morlocks as
35	I judged. The place was very silent. The thick dust deadened our
35	footsteps. Weena, who had been rolling a sea urchin down the sloping
35	glass of a case, presently came, as I stared about me, and very
35	quietly took my hand and stood beside me.
35	
35	'And at first I was so much surprised by this ancient monument of an
35	intellectual age, that I gave no thought to the possibilities it
35	presented. Even my preoccupation about the Time Machine receded a
35	little from my mind.
35	
35	'To judge from the size of the place, this Palace of Green Porcelain
35	had a great deal more in it than a Gallery of Palaeontology;
35	possibly historical galleries; it might be, even a library! To me,
35	at least in my present circumstances, these would be vastly more
35	interesting than this spectacle of oldtime geology in decay.
35	Exploring, I found another short gallery running transversely to the
35	first. This appeared to be devoted to minerals, and the sight of a
35	block of sulphur set my mind running on gunpowder. But I could find
35	no saltpeter; indeed, no nitrates of any kind. Doubtless they had
35	deliquesced ages ago. Yet the sulphur hung in my mind, and set up a
35	train of thinking. As for the rest of the contents of that gallery,
35	though on the whole they were the best preserved of all I saw, I had
35	little interest. I am no specialist in mineralogy, and I went on
35	down a very ruinous aisle running parallel to the first hall I had
35	entered. Apparently this section had been devoted to natural
35	history, but everything had long since passed out of recognition. A
35	few shrivelled and blackened vestiges of what had once been stuffed
35	animals, desiccated mummies in jars that had once held spirit, a
35	brown dust of departed plants: that was all! I was sorry for that,
35	because I should have been glad to trace the patent readjustments by
35	which the conquest of animated nature had been attained. Then we
35	came to a gallery of simply colossal proportions, but singularly
35	ill-lit, the floor of it running downward at a slight angle from the
35	end at which I entered. At intervals white globes hung from the
35	ceiling--many of them cracked and smashed--which suggested that
35	originally the place had been artificially lit. Here I was more in
35	my element, for rising on either side of me were the huge bulks of
35	big machines, all greatly corroded and many broken down, but some
35	still fairly complete. You know I have a certain weakness for
35	mechanism, and I was inclined to linger among these; the more so as
35	for the most part they had the interest of puzzles, and I could make
35	only the vaguest guesses at what they were for. I fancied that if
35	I could solve their puzzles I should find myself in possession of
35	powers that might be of use against the Morlocks.
35	
35	'Suddenly Weena came very close to my side. So suddenly that she
35	startled me. Had it not been for her I do not think I should have
35	noticed that the floor of the gallery sloped at all. [Footnote: It
35	may be, of course, that the floor did not slope, but that the museum
35	was built into the side of a hill.--ED.] The end I had come in at
35	was quite above ground, and was lit by rare slit-like windows. As
35	you went down the length, the ground came up against these windows,
35	until at last there was a pit like the ""area"" of a London house
35	before each, and only a narrow line of daylight at the top. I went
35	slowly along, puzzling about the machines, and had been too intent
35	upon them to notice the gradual diminution of the light, until
35	Weena's increasing apprehensions drew my attention. Then I saw that
35	the gallery ran down at last into a thick darkness. I hesitated, and
35	then, as I looked round me, I saw that the dust was less abundant
35	and its surface less even. Further away towards the dimness, it
35	appeared to be broken by a number of small narrow footprints. My
35	sense of the immediate presence of the Morlocks revived at that.
35	I felt that I was wasting my time in the academic examination of
35	machinery. I called to mind that it was already far advanced in the
35	afternoon, and that I had still no weapon, no refuge, and no means
35	of making a fire. And then down in the remote blackness of the
35	gallery I heard a peculiar pattering, and the same odd noises I had
35	heard down the well.
35	
35	'I took Weena's hand. Then, struck with a sudden idea, I left her
35	and turned to a machine from which projected a lever not unlike
35	those in a signal-box. Clambering upon the stand, and grasping this
35	lever in my hands, I put all my weight upon it sideways. Suddenly
35	Weena, deserted in the central aisle, began to whimper. I had judged
35	the strength of the lever pretty correctly, for it snapped after a
35	minute's strain, and I rejoined her with a mace in my hand more than
35	sufficient, I judged, for any Morlock skull I might encounter. And I
35	longed very much to kill a Morlock or so. Very inhuman, you may
35	think, to want to go killing one's own descendants! But it was
35	impossible, somehow, to feel any humanity in the things. Only my
35	disinclination to leave Weena, and a persuasion that if I began to
35	slake my thirst for murder my Time Machine might suffer, restrained
35	me from going straight down the gallery and killing the brutes I
35	heard.
35	
35	'Well, mace in one hand and Weena in the other, I went out of that
35	gallery and into another and still larger one, which at the first
35	glance reminded me of a military chapel hung with tattered flags.
35	The brown and charred rags that hung from the sides of it, I
35	presently recognized as the decaying vestiges of books. They had
35	long since dropped to pieces, and every semblance of print had left
35	them. But here and there were warped boards and cracked metallic
35	clasps that told the tale well enough. Had I been a literary man I
35	might, perhaps, have moralized upon the futility of all ambition.
35	But as it was, the thing that struck me with keenest force was the
35	enormous waste of labour to which this sombre wilderness of rotting
35	paper testified. At the time I will confess that I thought chiefly
35	of the _Philosophical Transactions_ and my own seventeen papers upon
35	physical optics.
35	
35	'Then, going up a broad staircase, we came to what may once have
35	been a gallery of technical chemistry. And here I had not a little
35	hope of useful discoveries. Except at one end where the roof had
35	collapsed, this gallery was well preserved. I went eagerly to every
35	unbroken case. And at last, in one of the really air-tight cases,
35	I found a box of matches. Very eagerly I tried them. They were
35	perfectly good. They were not even damp. I turned to Weena. ""Dance,""
35	I cried to her in her own tongue. For now I had a weapon indeed
35	against the horrible creatures we feared. And so, in that derelict
35	museum, upon the thick soft carpeting of dust, to Weena's huge
35	delight, I solemnly performed a kind of composite dance, whistling
35	_The Land of the Leal_ as cheerfully as I could. In part it was a
35	modest _cancan_, in part a step dance, in part a skirt-dance (so far
35	as my tail-coat permitted), and in part original. For I am naturally
35	inventive, as you know.
35	
35	'Now, I still think that for this box of matches to have escaped
35	the wear of time for immemorial years was a most strange, as for
35	me it was a most fortunate thing. Yet, oddly enough, I found a far
35	unlikelier substance, and that was camphor. I found it in a sealed
35	jar, that by chance, I suppose, had been really hermetically sealed.
35	I fancied at first that it was paraffin wax, and smashed the glass
35	accordingly. But the odour of camphor was unmistakable. In the
35	universal decay this volatile substance had chanced to survive,
35	perhaps through many thousands of centuries. It reminded me of a
35	sepia painting I had once seen done from the ink of a fossil
35	Belemnite that must have perished and become fossilized millions
35	of years ago. I was about to throw it away, but I remembered that
35	it was inflammable and burned with a good bright flame--was, in
35	fact, an excellent candle--and I put it in my pocket. I found no
35	explosives, however, nor any means of breaking down the bronze
35	doors. As yet my iron crowbar was the most helpful thing I had
35	chanced upon. Nevertheless I left that gallery greatly elated.
35	
35	'I cannot tell you all the story of that long afternoon. It would
35	require a great effort of memory to recall my explorations in at all
35	the proper order. I remember a long gallery of rusting stands of
35	arms, and how I hesitated between my crowbar and a hatchet or a
35	sword. I could not carry both, however, and my bar of iron promised
35	best against the bronze gates. There were numbers of guns, pistols,
35	and rifles. The most were masses of rust, but many were of some
35	new metal, and still fairly sound. But any cartridges or powder
35	there may once have been had rotted into dust. One corner I saw was
35	charred and shattered; perhaps, I thought, by an explosion among the
35	specimens. In another place was a vast array of idols--Polynesian,
35	Mexican, Grecian, Phoenician, every country on earth I should think.
35	And here, yielding to an irresistible impulse, I wrote my name upon
35	the nose of a steatite monster from South America that particularly
35	took my fancy.
35	
35	'As the evening drew on, my interest waned. I went through gallery
35	after gallery, dusty, silent, often ruinous, the exhibits sometimes
35	mere heaps of rust and lignite, sometimes fresher. In one place I
35	suddenly found myself near the model of a tin-mine, and then by the
35	merest accident I discovered, in an air-tight case, two dynamite
35	cartridges! I shouted ""Eureka!"" and smashed the case with joy. Then
35	came a doubt. I hesitated. Then, selecting a little side gallery,
35	I made my essay. I never felt such a disappointment as I did in
35	waiting five, ten, fifteen minutes for an explosion that never came.
35	Of course the things were dummies, as I might have guessed from
35	their presence. I really believe that had they not been so, I should
35	have rushed off incontinently and blown Sphinx, bronze doors, and
35	(as it proved) my chances of finding the Time Machine, all together
35	into non-existence.
35	
35	'It was after that, I think, that we came to a little open court
35	within the palace. It was turfed, and had three fruit-trees. So we
35	rested and refreshed ourselves. Towards sunset I began to consider
35	our position. Night was creeping upon us, and my inaccessible
35	hiding-place had still to be found. But that troubled me very little
35	now. I had in my possession a thing that was, perhaps, the best of
35	all defences against the Morlocks--I had matches! I had the camphor
35	in my pocket, too, if a blaze were needed. It seemed to me that
35	the best thing we could do would be to pass the night in the open,
35	protected by a fire. In the morning there was the getting of the
35	Time Machine. Towards that, as yet, I had only my iron mace. But
35	now, with my growing knowledge, I felt very differently towards
35	those bronze doors. Up to this, I had refrained from forcing them,
35	largely because of the mystery on the other side. They had never
35	impressed me as being very strong, and I hoped to find my bar of
35	iron not altogether inadequate for the work.
35	
35	
35	
35	
35	IX
35	
35	
35	'We emerged from the palace while the sun was still in part above
35	the horizon. I was determined to reach the White Sphinx early the
35	next morning, and ere the dusk I purposed pushing through the woods
35	that had stopped me on the previous journey. My plan was to go as
35	far as possible that night, and then, building a fire, to sleep
35	in the protection of its glare. Accordingly, as we went along I
35	gathered any sticks or dried grass I saw, and presently had my arms
35	full of such litter. Thus loaded, our progress was slower than I had
35	anticipated, and besides Weena was tired. And I began to suffer from
35	sleepiness too; so that it was full night before we reached the
35	wood. Upon the shrubby hill of its edge Weena would have stopped,
35	fearing the darkness before us; but a singular sense of impending
35	calamity, that should indeed have served me as a warning, drove me
35	onward. I had been without sleep for a night and two days, and I was
35	feverish and irritable. I felt sleep coming upon me, and the
35	Morlocks with it.
35	
35	'While we hesitated, among the black bushes behind us, and dim
35	against their blackness, I saw three crouching figures. There was
35	scrub and long grass all about us, and I did not feel safe from
35	their insidious approach. The forest, I calculated, was rather
35	less than a mile across. If we could get through it to the bare
35	hill-side, there, as it seemed to me, was an altogether safer
35	resting-place; I thought that with my matches and my camphor I could
35	contrive to keep my path illuminated through the woods. Yet it was
35	evident that if I was to flourish matches with my hands I should
35	have to abandon my firewood; so, rather reluctantly, I put it down.
35	And then it came into my head that I would amaze our friends behind
35	by lighting it. I was to discover the atrocious folly of this
35	proceeding, but it came to my mind as an ingenious move for covering
35	our retreat.
35	
35	'I don't know if you have ever thought what a rare thing flame must
35	be in the absence of man and in a temperate climate. The sun's
35	heat is rarely strong enough to burn, even when it is focused by
35	dewdrops, as is sometimes the case in more tropical districts.
35	Lightning may blast and blacken, but it rarely gives rise to
35	widespread fire. Decaying vegetation may occasionally smoulder with
35	the heat of its fermentation, but this rarely results in flame. In
35	this decadence, too, the art of fire-making had been forgotten on
35	the earth. The red tongues that went licking up my heap of wood were
35	an altogether new and strange thing to Weena.
35	
35	'She wanted to run to it and play with it. I believe she would have
35	cast herself into it had I not restrained her. But I caught her up,
35	and in spite of her struggles, plunged boldly before me into the
35	wood. For a little way the glare of my fire lit the path. Looking
35	back presently, I could see, through the crowded stems, that from my
35	heap of sticks the blaze had spread to some bushes adjacent, and a
35	curved line of fire was creeping up the grass of the hill. I laughed
35	at that, and turned again to the dark trees before me. It was very
35	black, and Weena clung to me convulsively, but there was still, as
35	my eyes grew accustomed to the darkness, sufficient light for me to
35	avoid the stems. Overhead it was simply black, except where a gap of
35	remote blue sky shone down upon us here and there. I struck none of
35	my matches because I had no hand free. Upon my left arm I carried my
35	little one, in my right hand I had my iron bar.
35	
35	'For some way I heard nothing but the crackling twigs under my feet,
35	the faint rustle of the breeze above, and my own breathing and the
35	throb of the blood-vessels in my ears. Then I seemed to know of a
35	pattering about me. I pushed on grimly. The pattering grew more
35	distinct, and then I caught the same queer sound and voices I had
35	heard in the Under-world. There were evidently several of the
35	Morlocks, and they were closing in upon me. Indeed, in another
35	minute I felt a tug at my coat, then something at my arm. And Weena
35	shivered violently, and became quite still.
35	
35	'It was time for a match. But to get one I must put her down. I did
35	so, and, as I fumbled with my pocket, a struggle began in the
35	darkness about my knees, perfectly silent on her part and with the
35	same peculiar cooing sounds from the Morlocks. Soft little hands,
35	too, were creeping over my coat and back, touching even my neck.
35	Then the match scratched and fizzed. I held it flaring, and saw the
35	white backs of the Morlocks in flight amid the trees. I hastily took
35	a lump of camphor from my pocket, and prepared to light it as soon
35	as the match should wane. Then I looked at Weena. She was lying
35	clutching my feet and quite motionless, with her face to the ground.
35	With a sudden fright I stooped to her. She seemed scarcely to
35	breathe. I lit the block of camphor and flung it to the ground,
35	and as it split and flared up and drove back the Morlocks and the
35	shadows, I knelt down and lifted her. The wood behind seemed full of
35	the stir and murmur of a great company!
35	
35	'She seemed to have fainted. I put her carefully upon my shoulder
35	and rose to push on, and then there came a horrible realization. In
35	manoeuvring with my matches and Weena, I had turned myself about
35	several times, and now I had not the faintest idea in what direction
35	lay my path. For all I knew, I might be facing back towards the
35	Palace of Green Porcelain. I found myself in a cold sweat. I had to
35	think rapidly what to do. I determined to build a fire and encamp
35	where we were. I put Weena, still motionless, down upon a turfy
35	bole, and very hastily, as my first lump of camphor waned, I began
35	collecting sticks and leaves. Here and there out of the darkness
35	round me the Morlocks' eyes shone like carbuncles.
35	
35	'The camphor flickered and went out. I lit a match, and as I did so,
35	two white forms that had been approaching Weena dashed hastily away.
35	One was so blinded by the light that he came straight for me, and I
35	felt his bones grind under the blow of my fist. He gave a whoop of
35	dismay, staggered a little way, and fell down. I lit another piece
35	of camphor, and went on gathering my bonfire. Presently I noticed
35	how dry was some of the foliage above me, for since my arrival
35	on the Time Machine, a matter of a week, no rain had fallen. So,
35	instead of casting about among the trees for fallen twigs, I began
35	leaping up and dragging down branches. Very soon I had a choking
35	smoky fire of green wood and dry sticks, and could economize my
35	camphor. Then I turned to where Weena lay beside my iron mace. I
35	tried what I could to revive her, but she lay like one dead. I could
35	not even satisfy myself whether or not she breathed.
35	
35	'Now, the smoke of the fire beat over towards me, and it must have
35	made me heavy of a sudden. Moreover, the vapour of camphor was in
35	the air. My fire would not need replenishing for an hour or so. I
35	felt very weary after my exertion, and sat down. The wood, too, was
35	full of a slumbrous murmur that I did not understand. I seemed just
35	to nod and open my eyes. But all was dark, and the Morlocks had
35	their hands upon me. Flinging off their clinging fingers I hastily
35	felt in my pocket for the match-box, and--it had gone! Then they
35	gripped and closed with me again. In a moment I knew what had
35	happened. I had slept, and my fire had gone out, and the bitterness
35	of death came over my soul. The forest seemed full of the smell of
35	burning wood. I was caught by the neck, by the hair, by the arms,
35	and pulled down. It was indescribably horrible in the darkness to
35	feel all these soft creatures heaped upon me. I felt as if I was in
35	a monstrous spider's web. I was overpowered, and went down. I felt
35	little teeth nipping at my neck. I rolled over, and as I did so my
35	hand came against my iron lever. It gave me strength. I struggled
35	up, shaking the human rats from me, and, holding the bar short,
35	I thrust where I judged their faces might be. I could feel the
35	succulent giving of flesh and bone under my blows, and for a moment
35	I was free.
35	
35	'The strange exultation that so often seems to accompany hard
35	fighting came upon me. I knew that both I and Weena were lost, but I
35	determined to make the Morlocks pay for their meat. I stood with my
35	back to a tree, swinging the iron bar before me. The whole wood was
35	full of the stir and cries of them. A minute passed. Their voices
35	seemed to rise to a higher pitch of excitement, and their movements
35	grew faster. Yet none came within reach. I stood glaring at the
35	blackness. Then suddenly came hope. What if the Morlocks were
35	afraid? And close on the heels of that came a strange thing. The
35	darkness seemed to grow luminous. Very dimly I began to see the
35	Morlocks about me--three battered at my feet--and then I recognized,
35	with incredulous surprise, that the others were running, in an
35	incessant stream, as it seemed, from behind me, and away through the
35	wood in front. And their backs seemed no longer white, but reddish.
35	As I stood agape, I saw a little red spark go drifting across a gap
35	of starlight between the branches, and vanish. And at that I
35	understood the smell of burning wood, the slumbrous murmur that was
35	growing now into a gusty roar, the red glow, and the Morlocks'
35	flight.
35	
35	'Stepping out from behind my tree and looking back, I saw, through
35	the black pillars of the nearer trees, the flames of the burning
35	forest. It was my first fire coming after me. With that I looked for
35	Weena, but she was gone. The hissing and crackling behind me, the
35	explosive thud as each fresh tree burst into flame, left little
35	time for reflection. My iron bar still gripped, I followed in the
35	Morlocks' path. It was a close race. Once the flames crept forward
35	so swiftly on my right as I ran that I was outflanked and had to
35	strike off to the left. But at last I emerged upon a small open
35	space, and as I did so, a Morlock came blundering towards me, and
35	past me, and went on straight into the fire!
35	
35	'And now I was to see the most weird and horrible thing, I think, of
35	all that I beheld in that future age. This whole space was as bright
35	as day with the reflection of the fire. In the centre was a hillock
35	or tumulus, surmounted by a scorched hawthorn. Beyond this was
35	another arm of the burning forest, with yellow tongues already
35	writhing from it, completely encircling the space with a fence of
35	fire. Upon the hill-side were some thirty or forty Morlocks, dazzled
35	by the light and heat, and blundering hither and thither against
35	each other in their bewilderment. At first I did not realize their
35	blindness, and struck furiously at them with my bar, in a frenzy of
35	fear, as they approached me, killing one and crippling several more.
35	But when I had watched the gestures of one of them groping under the
35	hawthorn against the red sky, and heard their moans, I was assured
35	of their absolute helplessness and misery in the glare, and I struck
35	no more of them.
35	
35	'Yet every now and then one would come straight towards me, setting
35	loose a quivering horror that made me quick to elude him. At one
35	time the flames died down somewhat, and I feared the foul creatures
35	would presently be able to see me. I was thinking of beginning the
35	fight by killing some of them before this should happen; but the
35	fire burst out again brightly, and I stayed my hand. I walked about
35	the hill among them and avoided them, looking for some trace of
35	Weena. But Weena was gone.
35	
35	'At last I sat down on the summit of the hillock, and watched this
35	strange incredible company of blind things groping to and fro, and
35	making uncanny noises to each other, as the glare of the fire beat
35	on them. The coiling uprush of smoke streamed across the sky, and
35	through the rare tatters of that red canopy, remote as though they
35	belonged to another universe, shone the little stars. Two or three
35	Morlocks came blundering into me, and I drove them off with blows
35	of my fists, trembling as I did so.
35	
35	'For the most part of that night I was persuaded it was a nightmare.
35	I bit myself and screamed in a passionate desire to awake. I beat
35	the ground with my hands, and got up and sat down again, and
35	wandered here and there, and again sat down. Then I would fall to
35	rubbing my eyes and calling upon God to let me awake. Thrice I saw
35	Morlocks put their heads down in a kind of agony and rush into the
35	flames. But, at last, above the subsiding red of the fire, above the
35	streaming masses of black smoke and the whitening and blackening
35	tree stumps, and the diminishing numbers of these dim creatures,
35	came the white light of the day.
35	
35	'I searched again for traces of Weena, but there were none. It was
35	plain that they had left her poor little body in the forest. I
35	cannot describe how it relieved me to think that it had escaped the
35	awful fate to which it seemed destined. As I thought of that, I was
35	almost moved to begin a massacre of the helpless abominations about
35	me, but I contained myself. The hillock, as I have said, was a kind
35	of island in the forest. From its summit I could now make out
35	through a haze of smoke the Palace of Green Porcelain, and from that
35	I could get my bearings for the White Sphinx. And so, leaving the
35	remnant of these damned souls still going hither and thither and
35	moaning, as the day grew clearer, I tied some grass about my feet
35	and limped on across smoking ashes and among black stems, that still
35	pulsated internally with fire, towards the hiding-place of the Time
35	Machine. I walked slowly, for I was almost exhausted, as well as
35	lame, and I felt the intensest wretchedness for the horrible death
35	of little Weena. It seemed an overwhelming calamity. Now, in this
35	old familiar room, it is more like the sorrow of a dream than an
35	actual loss. But that morning it left me absolutely lonely
35	again--terribly alone. I began to think of this house of mine, of
35	this fireside, of some of you, and with such thoughts came a longing
35	that was pain.
35	
35	'But as I walked over the smoking ashes under the bright morning
35	sky, I made a discovery. In my trouser pocket were still some loose
35	matches. The box must have leaked before it was lost.
35	
35	
35	
35	
35	X
35	
35	
35	'About eight or nine in the morning I came to the same seat of
35	yellow metal from which I had viewed the world upon the evening of
35	my arrival. I thought of my hasty conclusions upon that evening and
35	could not refrain from laughing bitterly at my confidence. Here
35	was the same beautiful scene, the same abundant foliage, the same
35	splendid palaces and magnificent ruins, the same silver river
35	running between its fertile banks. The gay robes of the beautiful
35	people moved hither and thither among the trees. Some were bathing
35	in exactly the place where I had saved Weena, and that suddenly gave
35	me a keen stab of pain. And like blots upon the landscape rose the
35	cupolas above the ways to the Under-world. I understood now what all
35	the beauty of the Over-world people covered. Very pleasant was their
